page.title: 12INDUSTRY (contd)
page.content: schemes. The other major industry in the area is Ford Motor Company. Set up in the 1960's, it is mainly responsible for supplying axles, transmissions and other components to other works in the Ford network within Britain and Europe. The works stretch along the main road (Fabian's Way) which leads out of Swansea. Two major works have closed down within the last ten years with a resultant loss of jobs for people who live in Port Tennant: Tir John Power Station and United Carbon Black. Both were causes of pollution in the area, especially the latter, and their closure was viewed with mixed feelings. The sites of both have now been cleared and plans are prepared to use them for leisure activities.
